ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pi píi fʉ̀ʼ na mèŋ, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ mèŋ m bíi fʉ̀ʼ na Keleto.
en: Imitate me, as I also imitate Christ.

ngiemboon: N nǎ ngɔ̀ɔnte gi páʼ pi tyé na yɛ̌ nò wɔ́ɔ, ńkímte wɔ́ɔn kimté. Mbɔɔ páʼ pi ne ńcwoŋo ńkúʼte mà gẅie n da zíʼi gẅí.
en: Now I praise you   because you remember me in everything and hold fast to the traditions  # 11:2 2Th 2:15; 3:6 just as I delivered  # 11:2 Jd 3 them to you.

ngiemboon: Áa mbòŋ táʼ, ammó ké ńnyé wó gie n ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi zsé mboŋó. Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin nyìŋ mbàŋa ntsèm, aa Keleto, nyìŋ gẅie à piŋ ńgẅiin manzwě, aa mámbàŋa, nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin Keleto, aa Ssé.
en: But I want you to know that Christ is the head   of every man, and the man is the head of the woman,  # 11:3 Or the husband is the head of the wife,# 11:3 Gn 3:16; Eph 5:23 and God is the head of Christ.  # 11:3 1Co 3:23

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mbàŋa lɔɔn ńgwaa sẅíŋte Ssé, kà ńgwaa tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwó Ssé wɔ́ɔ, ńdɔgɔ mmó ḿbwoon twó yé, mbà à lɔgɔ ńcʉŋe nzẅìŋ Keleto gẅie à gẅiin yé.
en: Every man who prays or prophesies with something on his head dishonors   his head.

ngiemboon: Tá manzwě gẅie à gwaa sẅíŋte Ssé, kà ńgwaa tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwó Ssé wɔ́ɔ, à te lɔgɔ mmó ḿbwoon twó yé wɔ́, à lɔgɔ púʼu, ńcʉŋe nzẅìŋ ndúm we gẅie à gẅiin yé, à tyé fʉʼó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ manzwě gẅie mé zẅagá twó yé la.
en: Every woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head, since that is one and the same as having her head shaved.

ngiemboon: Manzwě gẅie à kaa lɔgɔ mmó ḿbwoon twó yé wɔ́, à zẅag. Táʼ, páʼ áa mbwó manzwě ńgwɔ́ nò shʉ́ páʼ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ à twó yé gwɔ́ ye nzẅag kà ye nkwǒon wɔ́ la, à pwoon twó yé.
en: For if a woman doesn’t cover her head, she should have her hair cut off. But if it is disgraceful for a woman to have her hair cut off or her head shaved, let her head be covered.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na mámbàŋa, mba à te gẅiin légwaa tsyɛʼte Ssé, ḿbwoon twó yé wɔ́, mélàʼmie à sẅé Ssé. Mé líe yé ńgyá legúʼ Ssé. Tá ńgʉa na manzwě, mbà mé líe yé ńgyá pɔ́ legúʼ we mámbàŋa,
en: A man should not cover his head, because he is the image   and glory of God.  # 11:7 Mk 10:37; Lk 9:32; Jn 17:24; 2Co 3:18; 2Pt 3:18 So too, woman is the glory of man.

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé la fó pɔ́ na mámbàŋa ḿbwóon manzwě. À la te fó pɔ́ na manzwě tá ḿbwóon mámbàŋa wɔ́.
en: For man did not come from woman, but woman came from man.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la piŋ te pwóon mámbàŋa ńtí manzwě wɔ́. À la pwóon pɔ́ manzwě ńtí mámbàŋa.
en: Neither was man created for the sake of woman, but woman for the sake of man.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo manzwě gẅiin lépwoon twó yé, ńdɔg ńnyɛ ngie à ná nnɛ́ ssé á mvfò ndúm we. Púʼu, ńtí mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé.
en: This is why a woman should have a symbol of authority on her head, because of the angels.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgwɔ́ púʼu táʼ, ńgʉa na páʼ pege la nnɛ́ na Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ngwɔ́ manzwě le gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ mámbàŋa é té na tsɔ́ nò wɔ́ wɔ́. Mámbàŋa ké le gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ manzwě é té na tsɔ́ nò wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: In the Lord, however, woman is not independent of man, and man is not independent of woman.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ páʼ e Ssé la fó pɔ́ na nyìŋ mbàŋa ḿbwóon manzwě, manzwě zɔ kě ńzyé mámbàŋa. Ngwòŋo nò ntsèm piŋe éfóo pɔ́ mbwó Ssé.
en: For just as woman came from man, so man comes through woman, and all things come from God.

ngiemboon: Pi sáŋ gí tá ńjúʼ. Tà áa péʼe ńgwɔ́ mbòŋ ngie manzwě sẅíŋte Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto té pwoon twó yé?
en: Judge   for yourselves: Is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?

ngiemboon: Mé ée nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌, ńzsé ngie áa nò shʉ́ mbwó mámbàŋa létsẅɛ́ʼ menoŋo twó tà é sag.
en: Does not even nature itself teach   you that if a man has long hair it is a disgrace  # 11:14 2Co 6:8 to him,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, letsẅɛ̌ʼ menoŋo twó tà é sag kě ńgwɔ́ mbwó manzwě ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nò mekùʼ, á nue Ssé la gÿo menoŋo twó manzwě sag sag, ńgwɔ́ páʼ mmó gie á pwoon twó yé la.
en: but that if a woman has long hair, it is her glory?   For her hair is given to her  # 11:15 Other mss omit to her as a covering.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ńgyá ngie à ge zoŋo nò é náa na yɔɔn nò, mbà peg te gẅiin mà wendyɛ̀ʼɛ wɔ́. Mecúʼtè pʉ̀a Ssé ké te gẅiin mà wendyɛ̀ʼɛ wɔ́.
en: If anyone wants to argue about this, we have no other   custom, nor do the churches of God.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ́ nò gíŋ ńgwɔ́ ssé gie n ge gɔɔn nò mǒ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn. Á gwɔ́ gie pi ne ńgÿo á téen ḿboŋo wɔ́ɔn mɔ́. Pi ne ńkúu mecúʼtè mí, á cʉ́ʼʉ légwɔ́ gie nò mbòŋo á kɔʼɔ́ kẅɛɛ wó, aye tepòŋ zɔ̌ kẅɛ.
en: Now in giving this instruction I do not praise you, since you come together not for the better but for the worse.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na menò mie ée ssé, andùŋmvfò nò aa páʼ n ka jǔʼ ngie pi néŋe ssé tsɛ̀ɛ cúʼtè gí, afàgte gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ngwɔ́ n gyá ngie á ge gǎa wɔ́ɔ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ nò.
en: For to begin with, I hear that when you come together as a church there are divisions among you, and in part I believe it.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́ ngie pi gwɔ́ tà fagte menùɔ menùɔ, mé fó mǒ ńgyá pʉ̀a pie é té kwoŋo fàgte wɔ́.
en: Indeed, it is necessary that there be factions   among you, so that those who are approved may be recognized among you.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ ńgyá ngie pi kúu tsɛ̀ɛ cúʼtè, ńgwaa jÿó shúm léjÿó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nkwaŋá gẅí té tyé na yé wɔ́.
en: When you come together, then, it is not to eat the Lord’s Supper.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn páʼɔɔn, á nue afʉ̀ʼʉ léjÿó gwɔ́ tà ńkuʼ, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ sẅɛte ńnéŋe ssé, ńjÿó sé shúm sie à ně ńdɔg ńtó. Tà mé gyá petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwaa néŋe nzyè, mbà petsɔ́ pʉ̀a é nǔ tà ḿbím
en: For at the meal, each one eats his own supper.   So one person is hungry while another gets drunk!

ngiemboon: Pi te gẅiin mendá mí lénéŋe wó, ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, ḿbiŋ ńnú wɔ́ ka? Kà pi kwoŋo pɔ́ lélɔg shʉ́ ńkú pʉ̀a pie é té mmó léjÿó gẅiin, ńdɔgɔ púʼu ńgwága cúʼtè pʉ̀a Keleto? Pi gɔɔn ngie n gɔɔn né pi ngie kɔ́? Ngie n ná ngɔ̀ɔnte gi la? Ngǎŋ! Kwàʼ nénʉ́, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ ń de ngɔ̀ɔnte gi ná!
en: Don’t you have homes in which to eat and drink? Or do you despise the church of God and humiliate those who have nothing? What should I say to you? Should I praise you? I do not praise you in this matter!

ngiemboon: N da ké ńzíʼi gẅí mmó gie mèŋ zɔ la júʼu mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á gwɔ́ ngie: Á laa letsẅɛ́ʼ gẅie mé la sẅiŋe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, á pí mbelég,
en: For I received from the Lord what I also passed on to you:   On the night when he was betrayed, the Lord Jesus took bread,

ngiemboon: ńná ndǎg mbwó Ssé, ḿbwɔ́ʼ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Yɔɔn ee mbùm nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn gie mé náa na twó sí. Pi cʉ́ʼ ńne ńgÿo páʼɔɔn, ńdɔgɔ ńkímte wɔ́ɔn.»
en: and when he had given thanks, broke it, and said,   “This is my body, which is   # 11:24 Other mss add broken for you. Do this in remembrance of me.”   # 11:24 Lk 22:19

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jÿó mmó tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, á gíŋ ńkaa ntúʼ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Ntúʼ yɔɔn ee páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kʉ̀a sẅé gie e Ssé lɔgɔ metse mɔ́ɔn ńgwaa. Pi cʉ́ʼ ńne ńgÿo páʼɔɔn, ńdɔgɔ ńkímte wɔ́ɔn fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm gie pi ge gÿo ne núu.»
en: In the same way also he took the cup, after supper, and said, “This cup is the new covenant    in my blood.   # 11:25 Jn 6:54 Do this, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of me.”

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie ngwòŋ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm gie pi pfɛ̌ yɔɔn mbelég, ńgíŋ ńnú yɔɔn ntúʼ, pi lɔgɔ púʼu, ésáʼa ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kwé, é ké láʼa sáʼa pɔ́ púʼu, tà láʼ kú lyɛ̌ʼ gie à ge láʼ gíŋ tó.
en: For as often as you eat this bread and drink the cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death   until he comes.  # 11:26 Mk 8:38

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo mé gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿpfɛ́ mbelég Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, kà ńnú pɔ́ ntúʼ ye né ngwág wɔ́ɔ, mbà ngàŋ fʉ̌a nò na mbùm nnɛ́, mbɔɔ na metse Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: So, then, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sin against the body   and blood of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsaʼ mbùm ye. Tá ńdeen ńké ḿpfɛ́ yɔɔn mbelég ḿbiŋ ńnú yɔɔn ntúʼ,
en: Let a person examine himself; in this way let him eat the bread and drink from the cup.

ngiemboon: á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿpfɛ́ mbelég, ńnú túʼ, té ne ńkímte mmó gie é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn, mbà ngàŋ lɔgɔ ńtóŋte ntsaŋ ńnéŋe na yé.
en: For whoever eats and drinks without recognizing the body,   eats and drinks judgment  # 11:29 Mk 12:40; 1Jn 5:16 on himself.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńgwɔ́ meguɔ. Petsɔ́ gwɔ́ menkǒon, mbà petsɔ́ léen ńkwéte.
en: This is why many are sick and ill among you, and many have fallen asleep.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔɔn sele ńtsaʼa twó mbùm yégè, Ssé le gÿo ńŋaga wégè wɔ́.
en: If we were properly judging ourselves, we would not be judged,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ŋaga wégè, ńdɔgɔ ńtÿɔ́gte wégè, ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé láʼ ńteme wég lâ pʉ̀a njÿó mbú ńzáʼ ntsaŋ yege.
en: but when we are judged   by the Lord, we are disciplined, so that we may not be condemned  # 11:32 Mt 12:41; Jn 5:22 with the world.

ngiemboon: Púʼu la, mbà mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie pi cuʼté léjÿó shúm, pi pyɛ́b petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: Therefore, my brothers and sisters, when you come together to eat, welcome one another.

ngiemboon: Enzyè lɔɔn ne ńgyáŋa nyìŋ, á gwaa fó mbʉ̀a yé, ḿvɔg ńjÿó mmó, légwɔ́ gie pi te gʉa jʉʼ gie pi cúʼte wó, é tóŋte pɔ́ ntsaŋ gie Ssé ge ŋaga gẅí ŋag wɔ́. Á gʉa na metsɔ́ menò, mbà n ge gÿo tó tá táŋte.
en: If anyone is hungry, he should eat at home, so that when you gather together you will not come under judgment. I will give instructions about the other matters whenever I come.
